  mongo_op_msg = 1000, mongo_op_update = 2001, mongo_op_insert = 2002, mongo_op_query = 2004,
  mongo_op_get_more = 2005, mongo_op_delete = 2006, mongo_op_kill_cursors = 2007
}

  mongo_conn_not_master, mongo_conn_bad_set_name, mongo_conn_cannot_find_primary

bson_bool_t mongo_destroy ( mongo_connection *  conn  ) 

Close any existing connection to the server and free all allocated memory associated with the conn object.

You must always call this method when finished with the connection object.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
Returns:
false if the destroy succeeded.
bson_bool_t mongo_disconnect ( mongo_connection *  conn  ) 

Close the current connection to the server.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
Returns:
false if the the disconnection succeeded.

bson *  fields,
int  nToReturn,
int  nToSkip,
int  options 
)

Find documents in a MongoDB server.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
ns the namespace.
query the bson query.
fields a bson document of fields to be returned.
nToReturn the maximum number of documents to retrun.
nToSkip the number of documents to skip.
options options for the find query.
Returns:
a result cursor.

mongo_conn_return mongo_reconnect ( mongo_connection *  conn  ) 

Try reconnecting to the server using the existing connection settings.

This method will disconnect the current socket. If you've authentication, you'll need to re-authenticate after calling this function.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
Returns:
a mongo connection object.
void mongo_remove ( mongo_connection *  conn,
const char *  ns,
const bson *  cond 
)

Remove a document from a MongoDB server.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
ns the namespace.
cond the bson query.
int mongo_replset_add_seed ( mongo_connection *  conn,
const char *  host,
int  port 
)

Add a seed node to the connection object.

You must specify at least one seed node before connecting to a replica set.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
host a numerical network address or a network hostname.
port the port to connect to.
Returns:
0 on success.
mongo_conn_return mongo_replset_connect ( mongo_connection *  conn  ) 

Connect to a replica set.

Before passing a connection object to this method, you must already have called mongo_replset_init_conn and mongo_replset_add_seed.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
Returns:
a mongo connection return status.
void mongo_replset_init_conn ( mongo_connection *  conn,
const char *  name 
)

Initialize a connection object for connecting with a replica set.

Parameters:
conn a mongo_connection object.
name the name of the replica set to connect to.
